headline.main: False Rumors of Sickness at the Wesleyan University--Letter from the President.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: A very exaggerated statement has gone forth relative to the small-pox in this city, and its influence on the Wesleyan University. It has been reported that a large number of students are sick, and that the commencement exercises are deferred. The facts are as follows:

headline.main: CENTRAL AMERICA.; A Fleet Gone to Both Sides of the Isthmus.. HIGHLY IMPORTANT FROM NICARAGUA. The Refusal of President Martinez to Sign the Cass-Yrissari Treaty. GEN. CASS' DISPATCH TO GEN.LAMAR. Sharp Language----Vested Rights of Americans to be Protected.

docs.abstract: The Vanderbilt grant exploded - refusal of Martinez to execute the treaty
docs.lead_paragraph: By the steamship Columbus I have received the following letter on Transit matters, and the Cass-Yrissari Treaty, dated Managed, June 29, which is from a source that may be relied upon. My correspondent has seen Gen. CASS' dispatch on the refusal of President MARTINAZ to sign the Treaty, and quotes the substance of is as follows:

headline.main: LAUNCH OF THE SLOOP-OF-WAR BROOKLYN.; Description of the Steamer--Scenes in the Yard and on Board--The Collation sad Speeches.

docs.lead_paragraph: The launching of the United States steam sloop-of-war Brooklyn took place from the Westervelt Ship-yard yesterday morning. It was an occasion of unusual interest to the ship-builders of New-York, as well as to the thousands of citizens, male and female, who assembled to witness the spectacle.

docs.abstract: Examination of Frank Leslie on a charge of Libel
docs.lead_paragraph: Following the majority report of the Committee of the Board of Health, of which ??lderman TUOMEY was Chairman, favorable to Swill-milk and stumptail cows, a wood cut appeared in Frank Leslie's paper of a somewhat significant character. This cut represents the interior of a stable, the most promirent figures in which were a stump tail cow and five men. Three of the men it Is alleged bear a striking

docs.snippet: The Royal Mail steamship Europa, which passed Cape Race on Sunday, arrived at Halifax yesterday, on her way to Boston. We receive by telegraph, from Halifax, further details of her news, including a resume of the latest advices from India, which will...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Europa, which passed Cape Race on Sunday, arrived at Halifax yesterday, on her way to Boston. We receive by telegraph, from Halifax, further details of her news, including a resume of the latest advices from India, which will be found anything but favorable to the idea of the ultimate success of the British arms.

headline.main: CALIFORNIA.; $1,163,817 IN TREASURE. The Stampede to Frazer's River. ARRIVAL OF THE MOSES TAYLOR. INTELLIGENCE TO THE 5th OF JULY.

docs.abstract: Publishes a Scurrilous paper at Sacramento Arrested - Leaves

docs.snippet: The barks West Wind and Stampede., from Cienfugos, arrived to-day, and were ordered to the Lower Quarantine. There have been three arrivals at the station since yesterday from infected ports. The clipper-ship Competitor, Captain WHITE, from HAVANA,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The barks West Wind and Stampede., from Cienfugos, arrived to-day, and were ordered to the Lower Quarantine. There have been three arrivals at the station since yesterday from infected ports. The clipper-ship Competitor, Captain WHITE, from HAVANA, which port she left 14th inst., touching at Key West 15th for Provisions.

docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen met last evening, President CLANCY in the Chair. The following interesting and important petition was received, and together with an accompanying message from the Mayor, was referred to the Committee on Wharves, Piers and Slips.

headline.main: THE BOARD OF ALDERMEN.; Important Message from the Mayor--Free Salt Water Baths for the Masses--Ferry Franchises, &c.

docs.abstract: On Free Baths for the people
docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen met last evening, President CLANCY in the Chair. The following interesting and important petition was received, and together with an accompanying message from the Mayor, was referred to the Committee on Wharves, Piers and Slips.

docs.snippet: The Vanderbilt steamship Northern Light. Captain TINKLEPAUGH, arrived last evening from Bremen, Harve, and Southampton, with 200 passengers, and fight of D To BANCE. She brings the same advices as the Indian at Quebec.

docs.abstract: Collins Line refused permission to land at Portland
docs.lead_paragraph: We have highly important advices from Utah. which would appear to leave little doubt as to the settlement, at least for the present, of the difficulties with the Mormons. Dispatches received in St. Louis, and telegraphed to us, state that news from Salt Lake City to the 3d inst has been received.
